intro: Pappothrix, commonly known as the rock cress, is a genus of flowering plants belonging to the family Brassicaceae. It is characterized by its small, cruciform flowers and is typically found in rocky or alpine environments. The plants usually have a basal rosette of leaves and produce short, hairy stems. Pappothrix species are often perennial and exhibit a range of leaf shapes and sizes depending on the species. These plants are adapted to harsh conditions and are often used in ecological restoration projects.
